intro: Adenocalymma marginatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved adenocalymma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Western Cape province, where it grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in fynbos vegetation, which is a unique type of shrubland ecosystem. Adenocalymma marginatum is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
